intro: Viola silvatica var. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered woodland violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to forested regions of Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive violet underside and produces showy, violet-blue flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, thriving in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in deciduous woodlands and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
